“Without Prejudice”

 

Dear Shagan,

 

This refers to the below claim notification. 

 

In order to enable us to proceed further, you are requested to arrange for a survey(or provide local contact details, I will speak and arrange survey) and also provide us with the following documents at the earliest, to enable us to issue our report to your insurers. 

 

1.	Statement of an eyewitness, giving time, date of the incident, how it came to light, immediate action taken to control and minimize the damage.
2.	Copy of pre-dispatch survey report (if applicable).
3.	Original Invoice with Packing List
4.	Copy of bill of lading/airway bill (as applicable) 
5.	Copy of Bill of Entry.
6.	Notice of claim lodged on the carriers (Registered Post with receipt), with evidence of receipt by carriers.
7.	Damage Certificate from the carrier
8.	Claim bill with supporting documents. 

 

We look forward to hearing from you. In the meantime, if you have any query, please do not hesitate to contact us.

 

 

With Best Regards

 

Avinash R Gaikwad | Senior Loss Adjuster

BEng (Civil), PGDIM, FIII, ACII, Dip CILA

Hi Shagan


We have reviewed this matter carefully, as confirmed by you, the consignment was received in sound condition. Therefore, we believe that the items were damaged due to Defective packing by the consignor. 

 

As per the Institute of Cargo Clause (A), exclusion no 4.3 as attached to the Policy. 

 

This insurance shall not cover. 

 

‘’loss damage or expense caused by insufficiency or unsuitability of packing or preparation of the subject-matter insured to withstand the ordinary incidents of the insured transit.

 

Based on the above we regret to state that the damage is not covered by the policy.  Therefore, we proceeding to close this matter as NO CLAIM.

 

If you have any questions, please feel free to discuss. 

 

 

With Best Regards
